poem:
**Green Revisions**

From winter leaves whisper  
a new leader, bright green,  
sprouting from whispers and ballots.  
Borrowed words unfurl  
in eco-populist hues,  
singing a tune of change  
that rises with dawn.  
Votes like seeds scattered,  
taking root in the fertile soil  
of hopes and questions.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wednesday briefing: How Zack Polanski’s populist takeover could change the Green party forever Good morning. After a bruising leadership contest, Zack Polanski didn’t just win the Green party vote, he cleaned up. His “eco-populist” platform – which borrowed directly from Nigel Farage’s playbook – earned him 85% of votes. Polanski defeated Adrian Ramsay and Ellie Chowns, winning 20,411 votes relative to their 3,705 in a ballot of party members. The contest exposed deeper questions about". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
